sections.elevator_pitch: A Python CLI tool that transforms scattered GitHub issues across multiple repositories into actionable intelligence through automated snapshots, AI-powered analysis, and real-time dashboards. Built for engineering managers and solo developers who need to track work across multiple projects without manual aggregation.
sections.context_and_problem: Managing multiple GitHub repositories creates visibility gaps - issues are scattered, trends are hidden, and status reporting requires manual aggregation...
sections.solution_and_approach: Built a two-phase system: (1) Regular timestamped snapshots of GitHub issues stored as structured datasets, and (2) Agentic workflows that process snapshots to generate insights...

technical_implementation.architecture: Data Collection Pipeline, Workflow System, Dashboard, Status Tracking

key_design_decisions.rationale: Immutable historical data enables trend analysis without external databases
Leverages existing authentication, avoids API tokens, respects rate limits
Uses Ollama for privacy-preserving AI analysis without cloud dependencies

key_features: Flexible Organization (by repo, label, milestone, assignee)

outcomes_and_metrics.time_savings: Reduces status report preparation from 30+ minutes to < 2 minutes
outcomes_and_metrics.velocity_insights: 6-week velocity tracking with predictive milestone completion

technical_challenges.problem: Needed historical data for trend analysis without adding database dependency
technical_challenges.solution: Implemented timestamped directory structure with symlinks and metadata JSON

technical_challenges.problem: Streamlit runs in foreground; needed background daemon
technical_challenges.solution: Built process manager with PID files, graceful shutdown, log rotation

technical_challenges.problem: Cloud LLM APIs expose project data
technical_challenges.solution: Integrated Ollama for local LLM inference, zero external dependencies

learnings_and_growth: Agentic Architecture: Learned to design systems with autonomous agents
CLI UX Design: Orchestration scripts > complex flag combinations
Snapshot Pattern: Immutable timestamped data simplifies workflows
Local-First AI: Ollama proved local LLMs are viable for dev tools
Process Lifecycle: Unix process management, signals, daemon patterns
